result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonel Gallegos

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Cases 21CF345 & 22CF119 called at 3:30 PM 
Defendant Leonel Gallegos in court.  Attorney Erik I. Colque in court for Leonel Gallegos.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Colque requests trial remain scheduled. 
--no objection from DA Hall

recess: 3:31pm

Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[MK] cases #21CF345 and #22CF119 called at 3:34pm 
Defendant Leonel Gallegos in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case #21CF345 is scheduled for Final Status Conference today and for Jury Trial next week, however both counsel agree that adjournment of the trial is needed. ADA Teuber provides information that a piece of evidence that has not yet been evaluated is now available for evaluation; the outcome of this evaluation is expected to provide benefit either to the State or to the Defense. Time will be needed for the evaluation process and then to receive reports.
The Court reschedules the trial date.
recess 3:40pm 

NEXT:  (1) Status Conference on October 13th at 3:30pm,  (2) FSSC in Case #21CF345 and Status Conference in Case #22CF119-both on November 22nd at 3:30pm,  (3) Jury Trial in Case #21CF345 on November 29th and November 30th at 8:15am
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[MK] cases #21CF345 and #22CF119 called at 2:02pm 
Defendant Leonel Gallegos in court with Attorney Erik Colque. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In Case #22CF119 Prelim Waiver and Arraignment is held:  
--Mr.Gallegos waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 2:11pm 

NEXT:   (1) FSSC in Case #21CF345 and Status Conference in Case #22CF119--both on August 2nd at 3:30pm- Defense counsel can appear remotely for this hearing due to being in trial in another county, (2) Jury Trial in Case #21CF345 on August 8th at 8:15am.
Status conference on March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions of Bond include: 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

[MK] case called at 1:28pm
Defendant Leonel Gallegos appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Erik Colque. Public Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
Mr. Gallegos verifies that the 200 Lynn Street address is current.  
recess 1:32pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on March 25th at 2:00pm (JA-please note in comments that the case is at prelim stage)

Adjustment Number: 22A 048737,
Payable Number: 189818,
Receipt Number: 22R 003865,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant has pending case assigned to Branch 1
